content.question: The development of new political theories in the Enlightenment, such as those of Locke and Rousseau, can be explained as a reaction to

choices.label: increased persecution of religious minorities in most European states
the abandonment of attempts to create a unified European state under a single monarch
the increasing numbers of Europeans living in overseas colonies that had some degree of self-governance
the growth of absolutist forms of government across much of Europe

content.answer: the growth of absolutist forms of government across much of Europe

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
